body.p:
Manchester Ky July 31st 1865
Thomas E Bramlette Esq

I herewith send send a petition of Hugh Mize of color, for the Interposition of your prerogative in his behalf the fact in his case are set forth in the petition -- and authenticated by the names of his neighbours Annexed there to I, could have sent You his passt he obtained at the Cumberland Gap Tennessee to come in to Kentucky, but thought it not necessary, The fact is the Law has nearly become obsolete and can not be enforced for any how for sometime without oppression I am ignorant of Your powers to act in the case but am satisfied you can stay proceedings for a while, as your Excellency did in the Case of the Commonwealth vs Silkirk who was Indicted more than a year ago in this county, And petitioned Your favor Hopeing to hear from You soon in the case I am your

most obt servt
R P Young
